intro: Rhinanthus adriaticus, commonly known as the Adriatic rue-anemone, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Europe. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive tubular shape. It plays a role in supporting pollinators and is of interest in ecological and botanical studies.
